name: Dwarika's Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kathmandu is a crazy, chaotic city. But hidden within it is a beautiful oasis of tranquility and beauty. The Dwarikas style is typical Nepali with 5 star comfort and excellent food. The courtyard where breakfast is served is picturesque. The staff are very helpful and very friendly. Some of the rooms (older ones) have a musty smell from the shower but ours was fine. We stayed here twice - before and after our trek and without a doubt we would stay here again.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel

reviews.text: Just stayed here for two nights after a three week trek and it was absolute heaven! An absolutely stunning retreat in the heart of an incredibly chaotic city and as soon as you arrive, you feel a million miles away. Beautiful courtyard grounds and pool, and fabulous bars and restaurants dotted all around. Fusion bar did amazing cocktails and the signature Nepali restaurant was an amazing experience. The spa was lovely and my husband and I both enjoyed the Himalayan Trekkers Massage (much needed!) The rooms were stunning - absolutely massive and so luxurious. Staff were fabulous and service was excellent. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and it gave us a truly relaxing, luxurious and romantic end to our trip. Fabulous!
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Dwarikas for two nights at the end of October 2012 in one of the suites. It was a marvellous and very spacious suite. All the positives things you read in the other reviews about the nice and friendly staff, the good service, the beautiful premises and so on, we can absolutely confirm. Bare in mind that this is Nepal, so we rated it excellent. Would this hotel be in a western part of the world, we would complain about stains in sheets and towels, the quality of used materials, the very hard beds and the cleanliness, but that goes for all top notch hotels in Nepal.
reviews.title: Great heritage experience

reviews.text: I have just returned from a fantastic 4 day visit to Kathmandu and opted to stay in the Dwarika hotel thanks to the great reviews on trip advisor.
reviews.title: Great traditional hotel in the heart of the city

reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location for seeing the wonders of the city and is designed in traditional Nepali style. The rooms are large, clean and boast all the comforts you would expect from a 5* hotel. The grounds of the hotel are very nice, with a lovely swimming pool, hindu/budist shrines and plenty trees and plants to offer a nice escape from the hustle and bustle outside.
reviews.title: Set back several centuries, but in luxury !!!

reviews.text: Ths is the only place to choose when looking for a luxury hotel option in Kathmandu. Opened over 50 years ago, when Dwarikas started a project to protect the heritage of the city and used reclaimed wooden beams, doors etc... to develop what is a truly unique hotel. You step away from the busy streets of the city and into the quiet, calm courtyard of the hotel. The friendly smiles and genuine helpful nature of everyone you encounter is wonderful. There is plenty of choice within the complex - from three excellent restaurants (the best Nepalese Restaurant in the country, offering a real gastronomic experience, Japanese and International), a Bar full of character, Library/Lounge, Outdoor Swimming Pool, Shops and of course, the lovely courtyard to relax in and enjoy drinks and dining. Bedrooms are spacious and have everything you want from a luxury hotel. A wonderful touch was the hot water bottle at turndown. Breakfast is excellent, with plenty of choice. There is plenty of information about the retoration and development project that the hotel grew from and they are even restoring a local temple. The hotel is a little away from the old city, but close to some of the key sights and attractions of Kathmandu (everywhere is a cheap taxi ride away). The airport is also easily reached (traffic can be terrible in Kathmandu, so this is handy). The owners are still very much involved (third generation) and this creates a lovely family feel to the experience. You will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: A great heritage and full of character

reviews.text: After a 3-week hardcore expedition to the summit of Mera Peak, the only sensible thing to do was to check into Dwarika's for 3 days of doing absolutely nothing except partake of the glorious cuisine in the various restaurants, lounge around on the fabulous diwan in my room and watch CNN World News, or stroll the wonderful grounds awaiting my next meal. Dwarika's is THE ONLY TRUE LUXURY HOTEL IN KATHMANDU, bar none. My room - a standard one - is gigantic, gorgeous and well stocked with everything I want, including looseleaf special blend herbal tea, hot water bottles in the beautiful bed, a wonderful shower and plenty of room for suitcases, expedition bags and other goodies. I have spa appointments back to back for the next 4 days - already did the 2.15 hr Himalayan scrub/steam/massage, as well as the "Trekker's Special" which beat the kinks out of my battered body within the hour. All staff are top notch, including the doe-eyed concierge Shiva who tried his utmost to serve any upcoming request I had (reservations at the legendary Friday night BBQ, a table at Mako, the 22-dish Nepali luxury restaurant blast, etc.) I've shopped for fabulous cashmere sweaters right here in the store on Dwarika's grounds - no need to leave the compound and get all frazzled with the ugliness in K-du (sorry but I find it stressful and yes, very unattractive with all the dust and fumes). Pool, gym, fantastic breakfast brunch - aaah, I'm constantly hungry here after no food at all for weeks on the exped.
reviews.title: My paradise in Kathmandu

reviews.text: Forget staying anywhere else in K-du - just forget it. Book a standard room with dual sinks, giant bathtub made for two normal-sized people if so inclined, have drinks at the bar, watch some complimentary movies, take a yoga class and just breathe in the sophistication and stunning architecture that is Dwarikas. No request too impossible for the refined staff so eager to please. And the food. The food......... what are you waiting for? Book now!
reviews.title: Paradise Haven in Nepal

reviews.text: From the moment to enter the doors into the Dwarika courtyard from the manic streets of Kathmandu you know you are somewhere quite special.
reviews.title: Provides an unforgettable experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A calmness and tranquility is everywhere - very attentive staff make sure even the simplest request is carried out with care and attention - and you're made to feel very welcome.
reviews.title: The best place to stay!!

reviews.text: A group of 6 of us on the 1st Class Tour of Nepal with Mountain Kingdoms stayed at Dwarika's for 2 nights at the beginning of our holiday and 2 nights at the end.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: The rooms we had were wonderful - clean, spacious and had everything you could want (tho we did not get the fruit or chocolates that previous guests commented on!).
reviews.title: Dwarika's Hotel

reviews.text: The architecture of the whole place is unique, and it has a serene feeling about it, great after spending time shopping in town!
reviews.title: The best hotel in Nepal

reviews.text: Breakfasts were superb, and all the team are there to help you. Other meals in the Hotel were very good except for the one in the Japanese Restaurant - don't bother with this one, the tempura was 90% batter, the service a little below par - we were silly to go for japanese food in Nepal.
reviews.title: SPECTACULAR!

reviews.text: One thing to remember is that the prices you see on the menu do not represent the price on the final bill - add 10% service charge and then add 13.5% VAT and you're there. We thought it would have been more 'open' to show a price inclusive of VAT and the service charge should be up to the individual.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel in the middle of Kathmandu

reviews.text: First time in Nepal with my family and we were lucky that we booked Dwarik Hotel... loved the food, atmosphere and the well trained staff ... we felt safe and secure... the only thing that they don’t have is the kids activity which for us it didn’t matter that much since we were out all day long … but still we would love to see some kids facilities in the Hotel… but in general we had an amazing time and we would love to go back.. we highly recommend it ...
reviews.title: The best option in Kathmandu

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night at the end of our tour and it was a great place to relax and unwind before the long trip home. A beautiful modern hotel built from 'recycled' materials,including carved windows, doors and furniture. Huge rooms; attentive staff. Excellent buffet breakfast. Quiet but conveniently located near the airport and only a 250 rupee ride from Thamel. Expensive by Nepal, but not global, standards. Pool was a bit chilly but everything else was excellent.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel
Tranquility in the middle of chaos
reviews.text: What a wonderful place to stay. The hotel gives a warm feeling of gracious living within 10 minutes of the airport (traffic willing) It has been tastefully developed in a traditional manner. We have stayed here on 2 occasions and particularly enjoyed the Nepalese restaurant within its complex. Reality hits you full on when ever you step outside the main entrance with its chaos and traffic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concept of using a hotel to preserve craftsmanship is very worthwhile and it is done very well. The buildings could be old, but in fact they are near brand new. We stayed in two visits of 4 and one night. The first two days were sheer magic. Everything worked perfectly and the setting worked its magic on us. The second two days were much less magical. The bathroom started to smell, and it seemed as if the A team had left and been replaced by Basil Fawlty's cousins. All sorts of mistakes were made, from the serious (reception losing our air tickets!) to the silly ("do you have a reservation sir") when arriving for breakfast. There were many excellent staff to counterbalance this, especially the guest relations group.
reviews.title: Wonderful Concept

reviews.text: On the second visit it seemed that our feedback had been received and understood as we were upgraded without a word from either side. Back to wonderful, until.... our reservation for the famous barbecue somehow did not materialise. Same silly stuff again.
reviews.title: Wonderful Ambiance

description: Built upon a rich tradition of Nepali hospitality and incorporating some of the country’s most exquisite architectural traditions, The Dwarika’s Hotel in Kathmandu is an authentic experience of Nepal’s ancient cultural heritage.Originally established as a heritage restoration project, The Dwarika's hotel has become known as Nepal's premier property, and a model for heritage preservation in Nepal and beyond.
